title: Concavity from a table of second derivative values

content.question: The polynomial function f has selected values of its second derivative <math> <msup> <mi> f </mi> <mo> â€³ </mo> </msup> </math> given in the table above. Which of the following statements must be true?

choices.label: f is increasing on the interval <math> <mrow> <mrow> <mo> ( </mo> <mrow> <mn> 0 </mn> <mo> , </mo> <mn> 2 </mn> </mrow> <mo> ) </mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> .
f is decreasing on the interval <math> <mrow> <mrow> <mo> ( </mo> <mrow> <mn> 0 </mn> <mo> , </mo> <mn> 2 </mn> </mrow> <mo> ) </mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> .
f has a local maximum at <math> <mrow> <mi> x </mi> <mo> = </mo> <mn> 1 </mn> </mrow> </math>
The graph of f has a point of inflection at <math> <mrow> <mi> x </mi> <mo> = </mo> <mn> 1 </mn> </mrow> </math>
The graph of f changes concavity in the interval <math> <mrow> <mrow> <mo> ( </mo> <mrow> <mn> 0 </mn> <mo> , </mo> <mn> 2 </mn> </mrow> <mo> ) </mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> .

content.answer: The graph of f changes concavity in the interval <math> <mrow> <mrow> <mo> ( </mo> <mrow> <mn> 0 </mn> <mo> , </mo> <mn> 2 </mn> </mrow> <mo> ) </mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> .

topic.text: 5.6: Determining Concavity of Functions over Their Domains

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
